question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that no area of Ukraine falls under any of the following classifications:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control over any segment of Ukraine.

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if any section of Ukraine is deemed to fall within any of the categories that suggest Russian control, which encompasses but is not limited to:

- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

para_P.title: Will any portion of Ukraine be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates any section of Ukraine categorized under any of the following:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Dominance

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over any segment of Ukraine.

The inquiry will resolve as **No** if no segment of Ukraine is evaluated as falling under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Actions

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

not_P.title: Will no portion of Ukraine be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates no section of Ukraine categorized under any of the following:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Dominance

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over any segment of Ukraine.

The inquiry will resolve as **No** if at least one segment of Ukraine is evaluated as falling under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Actions

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

para_P.title: By June 1, 2024, will there be any part of Ukraine that falls under the control of Russia?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, following the evaluation by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows any area of Ukraine classified under one or more of the following:

- Assessed Russian Advances in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control over any part of Ukraine.

The question will be resolved as **No** if no area of Ukraine is classified under any categories that imply Russian control, including but not limited to:

- Recorded Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Announced Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories established by ISW that demonstrate Ukrainian control over the region or the absence of Russian control over the region.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Biden withdrawing prior to 7/13?

para_P.title: Could Biden potentially withdraw before 7/13?
para_P.body: If Biden chooses to step down or is unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will end with a yes. Otherwise, it will finish with a NO.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to suppress debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least one House Member or Senator affiliated with the Democratic Party signs a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

If this condition is not fulfilled by the market closure, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, trustworthy reports suggest that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is lower than or equal to $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal counts released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) in the event that IOC reporting is not available. If not, the market will settle on "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to consider invoking the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain unrecognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other applicable body) do not utilize Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and do not enable the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded from consideration. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator does not request Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 not be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
not_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) does not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and does not appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to not use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Section 4 of the 25th Amendment be enacted to determine Biden as incapacitated before August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not part of this inquiry. Biden's own activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican legislator is urging Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

not_P.body:

not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 not be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
The answer is YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and do not appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator does not request Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to September?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate group) enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

not_P.title: Will Biden be deemed able to fulfill his presidential responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to September?
not_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate group) does not enact Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and duties of his office" and does not allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit to carry out his duties as president under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before September?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable group), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden triggering Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator has urged Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not included.

This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it unlikely that Biden will be declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) do not invoke the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and consequently allow the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of any incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator does not request Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or appropriate authority) invokes the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's self-invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

not_P.title: Will Biden not be officially recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or appropriate authority) does not invoke the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and does not allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's self-invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be declared officially incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or relevant authority), invokes the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this inquiry. Biden's self-application of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: GOP lawmaker calls on Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

not_P.title: Will Russian athletes not be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are not barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If 34 or fewer Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: Will athletes from Russia be prevented from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:

The resolution will be based on the official roster of nations and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or on reliable media coverage, showing that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have concluded without the involvement of Russian athletes. For a **Yes** resolution, the number of competing Russians must not exceed 34. This limit was determined as 10% of [Russian athletes who participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes take part in the 2024 Olympics, this query will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed until 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. at least one team playing the final of the last event has won one of the others).

This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault credited to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran, resulting in the fatalities of a minimum of five people.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, no men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the men's pole vault Olympic record will be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, during the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter achieves a height of 6.04m or greater, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, it will be deemed **No** if this does not occur.

If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.body:

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

not_P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 4 or greater than 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is not greater than 4 or not less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 4 but does not go beyond 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is above 4 and at most 5, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day history data product.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) does not surpass 4 or is not 5 or lower, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 3 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 3 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Summer Games, will a minimum of 3 nations secure their inaugural gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if 3 or more nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will less than 3 nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if less than 3 nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will a minimum of three nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if three or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will fewer than three nations secure their first gold medal?
not_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if fewer than three nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if three or more countries obtain their first Olympic gold medal during the Paris Games, according to [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is not sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be stepping down from his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his intention to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

If he does not make such a declaration, this market will conclude with a NO on September 1st.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

not_P.body:

The resolution will be based on the official roster of nations and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media sources indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have finished without the involvement of Russian athletes. The figure of 34 was selected as 10% of the [Russian athletes that took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.body:

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
